event_name: Major tariff increases >25% on key inputs

derivation.data_source: WTO Trade Monitoring Report + structural analysis

p_preconditions.evidence: WTO TMR: cumulative trade-restrictive stockpile at record $2.4T. GPR trade tension sub-index elevated since 2018.

p_trigger.evidence: Non-election year but persistent US-China/EU-China tensions. WTO: 70% of election years 2016-2024 had new major measures.

p_implementation.evidence: Historical: ~70% of announced >25% tariffs implemented within 12 months. Based on WTO stockpile data 2016-2024.

calibration.justification: WTO data: Trade restrictive measures increase ~25% in US election years (2016: +28%, 2020: +22%, 2024: +31% vs non-election year baseline)

metadata.divergence_reason: Method C structural analysis with 2024-2026 evidence: preconditions=0.80 (WTO stockpile at record), trigger=0.60, implementation=0.70. Higher than old estimate (22%) due to elevated trade tensions since 2018.
